summary: An email from June 23, 2020, discussing the timing of an unspecified action related to the Epstein case and requesting review of talking points for Ghislaine Maxwell to be briefed to the Attorney General. It indicates internal DOJ coordination and preparation for high-profile cases.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.context: A DOJ official who is not ready to move forward on a case action and will be briefing the Attorney General about upcoming high-profile cases, including Ghislaine Maxwell's.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of talking points being prepared for a briefing to the Attorney General regarding upcoming high-profile cases.

connections.description: Audrey is preparing to brief the Attorney General about the case involving Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a prosecutorial relationship.

events.title: AG Briefing on High-Profile Cases
events.description: Audrey is scheduled to brief the Attorney General about a number of higher profile upcoming cases, including the Maxwell case.

events.title: Preliminary Conversation with Audrey
events.description: A preliminary conversation was held with Audrey regarding the timing of a case action, where concerns were raised.

keyFacts: The email discusses internal DOJ coordination on the timing of an action related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, indicating ongoing case management in June 2020.
A DOJ official named Audrey is preparing to brief the Attorney General specifically about the Ghislaine Maxwell case, highlighting its status as a 'higher profile' matter.
The communication shows the preparation of official 'talking points' for the Maxwell case ahead of a briefing with the Attorney General.
